column4: can some1 help me. Vi isnt displaying the file i opened with it
linux is case-sensitive.  You probably meant to type: /etc/X11/xorg.conf
ESCAPE :q ENTER.  Why are you using vi instead of nano?
why don't you take a step back and tell us what you are trying to accomplish?
you're either making a typo or the file does not exist
im not making it up, theres no typo, and how can xorg.conf not exist
seems like everything is right then.  Your file is empty.
would that have to do with using an alternate install cd?
well you don't need an xorg.conf at all.  I doubt it has anything to do with the use of the alternate cd
how would i go about changing the resolution then?
